column4: Kennie: i mean i have like 6 movies, but they only add up to 5gb or something (avi format)
those are probably my biggest files
i would check  /var/cache/apt/archives and see if it has a bunch of deb files in there. if it does then in terminal   sudo apt-get clean  will remove them
will sudo apt-get clean delete anything i dont want it to delete?
no they are deb files you have already downloaded and installed
nah, it didnt do anything legends
so i used disk analyzer and i deleted a bunch of stuff, but i still only have 50g  left out of over 100gb+ disk space
it says that i have 95.5 gb used in disk analyzer, but i definitely dont!
oh thats why, ok im not sure if i can see my second hard drive, how do i add that to my linux partition
in Disk analyzer click   edit>preferences and click box next to the partition with mountpoint   / so it checks only that one
